result.execSummary:
Oscar Flores-Rivera was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Oscar Flores-Rivera was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Flores-Rivera

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Oscar Flores-Rivera not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Oscar Flores-Rivera.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant has been turned over to the State of California.  Court orders case closed.

Defendant Oscar Flores-Rivera in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Oscar Flores-Rivera in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oscar Flores-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Court found the Defendant is the person wanted in the State of CALIFORNIA. Defendant WAIVED Extradition and signed Waiver. Court ordered the Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
